intro: Diplopterygium yunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan diplopterygium, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences and strikingly colored bracts. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats and has adapted to the cool, humid climates of its native environment. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy surface, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, relying on the colorful bracts for attraction. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
